comments.raw_text: Over time various parts of Firefox Bug 453442 (Secure favicon.ico request pop-ups certificate error dialog) have been ported over. This bug ports the remaining bit in tabbrowser.xml.
comments.text: Over time various parts of Firefox Bug 453442 (Secure favicon.ico request pop-ups certificate error dialog) have been ported over. This bug ports the remaining bit in tabbrowser.xml.
comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.creator: philip.chee@gmail.com
neil@httl.net
comments.author: neil@httl.net
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Philip Chee from comment #0)
> This bug ports the remaining bit
I don't think any of our favicon code uses documentURIObject, or what did you mean by the remaining bit?
comments.text:
(In reply to Philip Chee from comment #0)
> This bug ports the remaining bit
I don't think any of our favicon code uses documentURIObject, or what did you mean by the remaining bit?

comments.creator: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Cancelling review request.

<NeilAway>RattyAway: none of our other callers uses documentURIObject
<RattyAway>NeilAway: two callers use documentURIObject
<NeilAway>RattyAway: actually I was thinking of SetPageProxyState, which is where we actually load favicons
<RattyAway>NeilAway: so you think we don't have the problem reported in Bug 453442?
<NeilAway>RattyAway: oh, I'm sure we do, just that your patch won't fix it
<RattyAway>NeilAway: so I should fix it in SetPageProxyState?
<NeilAway>RattyAway: well, something else needs fixing, yes
<RattyAway>NeilAway: sorry I don't know what to do then.
<NeilAway>wasn't suggesting you would
